content.en: Chronic Back Pain Algorithms: Researchers have been investigating various aspects of chronic low back pain in older adults and how algorithms can help guide its evaluation and management. These algorithms provide evidence-based recommendations for diagnosing and treating conditions such as depression, hip osteoarthritis, leg length discrepancy, dementia, anxiety, lateral hip and thigh pain, lumbar spinal stenosis, maladaptive coping, and syndromic diagnosis. Additionally, there is ongoing research to develop personalized medicine algorithms for optimizing treatment selection for patients with chronic low back pain.
content.da: Algoritmer for kroniske rygsmerter: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige aspekter af kroniske lænderygsmerter hos ældre voksne og hvordan algoritmer kan hjælpe med at vejlede evaluering og behandling. Disse algoritmer giver evidensbaserede anbefalinger til diagnosticering og behandling af tilstande som depression, hofteartrose, benlængdeforskel, demens, angst, smerter i ydre hofte og lår, lumbal spinal stenose, maladaptiv mestring og syndromdiagnose. Derudover er der igangværende forskning for at udvikle algoritmer for personlig medicin til optimering af behandlingsvalg for patienter med kroniske lænderygsmerter.
